title: Replace Electrolytes with Salt Water
brief: Make an electrolyte solution to replace body salts lost through sweating and dehydration.
steps: Step 1: Mix 0.25 teaspoon of salt into 1 liter of water.
Step 2: Stir thoroughly until salt completely dissolves.
Step 3: Drink this solution when experiencing heavy sweating or extreme conditions.
Step 4: Use this concentration as it matches what body tissues can readily absorb.
Step 5: For emergency rationing, use 2 teaspoons sugar per liter in a sugar-water mixture for at least a week.
warnings: Too much salt can cause nausea and worsen dehydration.
In extreme situations, additional electrolyte sources beyond normal diet are necessary.
